column4: Hi everyone. I'm kinda new to Linux and played around with some "chmod, adduser, addgroup and chown" in a folder called "test" I created in my home folder. Suddently I got got error "username is not in the sudoers file.  This incident will be reported."
Any idea what could have caused this?
but how could I have unset my sudo rights?
no. run sudo again. sudo rights are managed by /etc/sudoers
